item.title: 2 questions
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:19, topic:112504”]i think we did. im not sure. i kinda started to edit this from scratch form my last program so im a bit confused.

         BufferedWriter out = new BufferedWriter("File.txt");
         out.write(textName.getText().getBytes());
         out.close();

Redo that to:

         PrintWriter out = new PrintWriter(new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(new File("File.txt")))); //write the file
         out.write(textName.getText()); //write the javax.swing.JTextField.getText() string's value into the PrintWriter file
         out.close(); //close the PrintWriter stream

Also, change your IO imports from

import java.io.BufferedWriter;
import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
import java.io.FileOutputStream;

to

import java.io.*;

Finally, you will need to add a try catch statement to the entire block of code in the IndentFrame() constructor because the PrintWriter will through an IOException.

[/quote]
Try a try-catch block?
Or, you could import java.io.*;

Read full topic

item.title: 2 questions
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

         BufferedWriter out = new BufferedWriter("File.txt");
         out.write(textName.getText().getBytes());
         out.close();

Redo that to:

         PrintWriter out = new PrintWriter(new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(new File("File.txt")))); //write the file
         out.write(textName.getText()); //write the javax.swing.JTextField.getText() string's value into the PrintWriter file
         out.close(); //close the PrintWriter stream

Also, change your IO imports from

import java.io.BufferedWriter;
import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
import java.io.FileOutputStream;

to

import java.io.*;

Finally, you will need to add a try catch statement to the entire block of code in the IndentFrame() constructor because the PrintWriter will through an IOException.

Read full topic

item.title: 2 questions
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

says this under bufferedWriter

“the constructor bufferedWriter(string) is unidentified”

and under write it says

" the method write(int) in the type bufferedWriter is not applicable for the arguments (byte )"

heres my code -

mport javax.swing.;
import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.FlowLayout;
import java.awt.event.;
import java.awt.*;
import java.io.BufferedWriter;
import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
import java.io.FileOutputStream;

public class IdentFrame extends JFrame implements ActionListener
{
public static void main(String[] args)
{
new IdentFrame();
}

public IdentFrame()
{
	this.setSize(355,300);		
	   this.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);	   
		this.setTitle("Identification");
		
		Box box1 = Box.createHorizontalBox();
		JPanel panel1 = new JPanel();
		JLabel label1 = new JLabel("Gender:");
		JLabel label2 = new JLabel("Name:");
		JLabel space = new JLabel("                                                                                                                                                                                                                             ");
		JRadioButton but = new JRadioButton("1-10");
		JRadioButton but1 = new JRadioButton("10-25");
		JRadioButton but2 = new JRadioButton("25+");
		JButton button2 = new JButton("Close");
		JButton button1 = new JButton("Ok");
		JMenu file = new JMenu("File");
		JMenuItem exit = new JMenuItem("Exit");
		exit.addActionListener(this);
		JMenu edit = new JMenu("Edit");
		JMenu t = new JMenu("                                                                                           ");
		
		JPanel toppanel = new JPanel();
		toppanel.setLayout(new BorderLayout(0, 0));
		JMenuBar jmb = new JMenuBar();
		JLabel label3 = new JLabel("Age:");
		JTextField textName = new JTextField(15);
		JComboBox combo1 = new JComboBox();			
		BufferedWriter out = [u]new BufferedWriter("File.txt");[/u]
		out.[u]write[/u](textName.getText().getBytes());
		out.close();
		combo1.addItem("Choose");
		combo1.addItem("Boy");
		combo1.addItem("Girl");
		this.add(panel1);
		toppanel.add(jmb);
		jmb.add(file);
		file.add(exit);
		jmb.add(edit);
		
		jmb.add(t);
		panel1.add(jmb);
		panel1.add(toppanel);
		panel1.add(box1);
		panel1.add(label1);
		panel1.add(combo1);			
		panel1.add(label2);		
		panel1.add(textName);			
		panel1.add(label3);
		panel1.add(but);
		panel1.add(but1);
		panel1.add(but2);
		panel1.add(space);	
		
		
		panel1.add(button1);
		panel1.add(button2);
		button2.addActionListener(this);
		this.setVisible(true);
		
}

public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent evt) {
    String cmd = evt.getActionCommand();
    if(cmd.equals("Close"));
    System.exit(0);
    
if(cmd.equals("Exit"));
System.exit(0);

}

}

item.title: 2 questions
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

I made this up real quick. I tested it and it works. Use it as a reference:

import java.awt.*;
import java.awt.event.*;
import javax.swing.*;
import java.io.*;

public class SwingTest extends JFrame
{
	public SwingTest()
	{
		super("This is a simple Javax Swing test");
		makeGUI();
	}

	private void makeGUI()
	{
		setLocation(250, 250);
		setDefaultCloseOperation(3);
		JPanel main = new JPanel();
		main = (JPanel)this.getContentPane();
		JPanel topPanel = new JPanel();
		topPanel.setLayout(new BorderLayout(0, 0));
		JPanel centerPanel = new JPanel();
		centerPanel.setLayout(new BorderLayout(0, 0));
		final JTextArea jta = new JTextArea(30, 50);
		JMenuBar jmb = new JMenuBar();
		JMenu file = new JMenu("File");
		JMenu test = new JMenu("JMenu Test");
		JMenuItem save = new JMenuItem("Save File");
		save.addActionListener(new ActionListener()
		{
			public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e)
			{
				try
				{
					JFileChooser chooser = new JFileChooser();
					chooser.showSaveDialog(SwingTest.this);
					File savedFile = chooser.getSelectedFile();
					PrintWriter out = new PrintWriter(new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(savedFile)));
					out.write(jta.getText());
					out.close();
				}
				catch (IOException ioe) { ioe.printStackTrace(); }
			}
		});
		JMenuItem exit = new JMenuItem("Exit");
		exit.addActionListener(new ActionListener()
		{
			public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e)
			{
				System.exit(0);
			}
		});
		JMenuItem menuItemTest = new JMenuItem("JMenuItem test");
		menuItemTest.addActionListener(new ActionListener()
		{
			public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e)
			{
				System.out.println("test");
			}
		});
		file.add(save);
		file.addSeparator();
		file.add(exit);
		test.add(menuItemTest);
		jmb.add(file);
		jmb.add(test);
		topPanel.add(jmb);
		centerPanel.add(new JScrollPane(jta));
		main.add(topPanel, BorderLayout.NORTH);
		main.add(centerPanel, BorderLayout.CENTER);
		pack();
	}

	public static void main(String[] args)
	{
		new SwingTest().setVisible(true);
	}
}
